page.title: 01MIDMAR
page.content: Midmar is situated in the North-East of Scotland, about seventeen miles West of Aberdeen.It is between the two 'Mars', Braemar and Cromar, and is in the Gordon District of Grampian Region .The name Midmar is derived from the Anglo Saxon 'Midd' (middle) and the Gaelic 'Mar' (marsh).So Midmar is the middle marsh, between 'hill-marsh' (Braemar) and Cromar.It is very spread out, with the village centre at the school, and the cottages around it.The land is mainly agricultural.The village is very ruraland quiet.The hall and the school are the main 'communal' places,around which are farms and cottages!Overall,Midmar is agricultural, and there are many farms or converted steadings, showing that farming has always dominated the area.Recently,oil related industry has brought more residents.
